summary: This document is a grand jury exhibit presented in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell on June 29, 2020. It contains a collection of exhibits including correspondence, flight logs, and deposition transcripts. The exhibits show Jeffrey Epstein's financial contributions to Interlochen Arts Camp, flight records from 1994-1998, and excerpts from Ghislaine Maxwell's 2016 depositions where she denies knowledge of Epstein's alleged scheme to recruit underage girls and denies giving massages.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the recipient of a thank-you letter for a $200,000 donation to Interlochen Arts Camp. Appears in deposition questions regarding alleged sexual activities and recruitment of underage girls.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the grand jury proceeding. Appears in correspondence and is the subject of deposition transcripts where she is questioned about her knowledge of Epstein's activities and denies involvement in massages or knowledge of underage interactions.

persons.name: Leslie Fagin
persons.context: Identified as the court reporter and notary public who recorded the videotaped depositions of Ghislaine Maxwell in April and July 2016.

persons.name: Mr. Pagliuca
persons.context: An attorney who objects to questions during Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition, citing form and foundation.

persons.name: Perlman
persons.context: Mentioned in a letter to Jeffrey Epstein as giving a concert on August 7, 1994, at Interlochen.

connections.description: Maxwell is questioned about her relationship and knowledge of Epstein's activities. Correspondence shows they were both associated with the Interlochen donation.
Pagliuca objects to deposition questions on Maxwell's behalf, indicating a legal representation relationship.

events.title: Epstein Donation to Interlochen
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein makes a $200,000 donation to Interlochen Arts Camp for a new scholarship lodge, with a letter thanking him and Ghislaine.

events.title: Perlman Concert at Interlochen
events.description: Perlman is scheduled to give a concert at Interlochen, mentioned in the thank-you letter to Epstein.

events.title: Flight Log Entry
events.description: A flight log entry dated August 18, 1994, is included in the exhibits.

events.title: Flight Log Entry
events.description: A flight log entry dated August 20, 1994, is included in the exhibits.

events.title: Letter to Maxwell Regarding Found Envelope
events.description: Interlochen writes to Ghislaine Maxwell about an envelope found in the 'Epstein Lodge' during cleaning.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Deposition
events.description: Videotaped deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell is taken in New York. She is questioned about Epstein's alleged scheme to recruit underage girls and denies knowledge.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Deposition (Continued)
events.description: Continued videotaped deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell. She is questioned about sex toys at Epstein's Palm Beach house and her knowledge of his sexual activities, denying awareness.

events.title: Grand Jury Presentation
events.description: Grand jury presentation in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York
358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida
49 Zorro Ranch Road, Stanley, New Mexico
Interlochen Arts Camp / Interlochen Center for the Arts
The Villard House, 457 Madison Avenue, New York, NY 10022
Law offices of Boies Schiller & Flexner, 575 Lexington Avenue, New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein made a $200,000 tax-deductible donation to Interlochen Arts Camp in 1994, which included naming a lodge and personal use rights.
Flight log entries from 1994-1998 are included as exhibits, indicating travel patterns.
In her 2016 deposition, Ghislaine Maxwell denied knowledge of any scheme by Jeffrey Epstein to recruit underage girls for sexual massages.
Maxwell testified she was not aware of anyone under 18 she interacted with at Epstein's properties and denied ever giving anyone, including Epstein, a massage.
Maxwell testified she was not aware of Epstein having sexual activities with anyone other than herself and two other women on a few occasions during the 1990s and 2000s.
